results.title: Having a go: a look at small business in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Cassidy, Tony Coyte, Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with entrepreneurs from five successful small Australian businesses. Each provides advice on how to succeed while stressing the need to be fully informed and equipped with proper business skills. Highlights the importance of government sponsored small business agencies for providing information and training.

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: Fiji - legacies of empire
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Dennis O'Rourke, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series looks at the Pacific islands, the traditions associated with them and issues that pose problems to them. This particular film examines the different aspects of life in Fiji. It notes the opinions of a patriarch of the hard-working Indian population and explores the co-existence of Hindus and Moslems who own less than a fifth of the land. Camera by Dennis O’Rourke and Joe Pickering.

results.title: Castleguard Cave
results.creator_credit: Syd Perov, Derek Ford, Haverand Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adventure film of a different sort - the fascinating record of the exploration of Castleguard Cave under the Columbia Icefield in Banff National Park, an exhausting but irresistible crawl through more than 5 km of dark tunnel, the longest known in Canada. What beckons the members of the expedition, what they find, how they support the physical stress, the nagging doubts, and what their reward is - these are all questions they answer in this film. Award: Milton Keynes, England

results.title: Computers as work aids in transport; Impact of computers in local government
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
A compilation of two programs which examine the role of computers at work: 1. Computers as work aids in transport (16 min). - 2. Impact of computers in local government (16 min).

results.title: The Bloodhouse
results.creator_credit: Humphrey McQueen, Garry Lane and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: The power of big companies like BHP deeply affects our economy and environment and our way of life. The film describes the effects of highly developed capitalist industry - environmental pollution, disregard for workers conditions and the exploitation of migrant workers. The film shows conditions which helped to earn the Port Kembla steelworks the title of ‘Bloodhouse’.

results.title: A Changing Perspective
results.brief_description: This film covers the widening interests of the Australian Paper Mills company. An historical background is given and the present main interests of the company, forestry, paper and pulp are documented. New projects include a diverse range of activities such as paper, plastic and metal packaging

results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: Renewable energy in Australia
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Michael Rubetzki and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The film presents a range of alternatives to conventional energy sources for small-scale power requirements. Surveys the systems and technology currently available in Australia including wind, mini-hydro, biomass and photovoltaic systems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Robertson, Michael Rubetzki and Film Australia

results.title: Are girls calculating?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This videotape can be used not only in the maths-science classroom to encourage girls to see the importance of maths, but also as a valuable resource for careers teachers, and for social science units on either the workforce or sexism in society.
